snippet: A state appeals court agreed ruled that the legalization law, known as Amendment 64, could apply retroactively to minor drug offenses if people had already been appealing their convictions when the measure went into effect.
abstract: Colorado appeals court rules that marijuana legalization law may now allow some people found guilty of minor marijuana crimes to challenge in court if they had already been appealing their convictions when the measure went into effect.
lead_paragraph: A state appeals court agreed ruled that the legalization law, known as Amendment 64, could apply retroactively to minor drug offenses if people had already been appealing their convictions when the measure went into effect.

headline.main: Colorado Appeals Court Says Marijuana Law Can Be Used to Challenge Convictions
